text: 1 in 3 people behind bars is in a jail. Most have yet to be tried in court. Over 80% of those in jail under local authority have not been convicted and are presumed innocent. If you include the 103,000 people held in jails that rent out space to other agencies, 70% of all people in jails are unconvicted. Either way, jail incarceration rates are driven largely by local bail practices.
